Module com.example.battleship
Package com.example.battleship.Controllers

Class VictoryController

java.lang.Object
com.example.battleship.Controllers.VictoryController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class VictoryController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller for the victory/defeat screen.

Displays an appropriate video animation based on the game outcome (victory or defeat) and transitions to the statistics view after the animation completes.

  • Method Details

    • setStage

      public void setStage(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Sets the stage for this controller.
      Parameters:
      stage - the stage to be associated with this controller

    • setGameStats

      public void setGameStats(String playerName, boolean playerWon, int playerShipsSunk, int machineShipsSunk, int playerShots, int playerHits, int playerMisses, int machineMisses)
      Sets the game statistics and initializes the victory/defeat video.

      This method must be called after the controller is initialized and before the view is displayed. It stores all game statistics and triggers the video setup with the appropriate animation.

      Parameters:
      playerName - the name of the player
      playerWon - true if the player won, false if the player lost
      playerShipsSunk - number of enemy ships sunk by the player
      machineShipsSunk - number of player ships sunk by the machine
      playerShots - total number of shots fired by the player
      playerHits - total number of successful hits by the player
      playerMisses - total number of missed shots by the player
      machineMisses - total number of missed shots by the machine

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the controller.

      The video initialization is deferred until setGameStats(java.lang.String, boolean, int, int, int, int, int, int) is called to ensure all game data is available before starting the animation.

      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - the location used to resolve relative paths for the root object
      resourceBundle - the resources used to localize the root object

    • stopVideo

      public void stopVideo()
      Stops and disposes of the video player.

      Safely releases media resources and nullifies the media player reference.
